Articles.Content: Is it possible to use a mod such as MechJeb to be able to match an object's rotation when attempting to dock? I.E. Interstellar docking scene.
Docking Port Alignment Indicator can help you with that. You still have to do it manually.
Mechjeb does have the PAR+ and PAR- buttons, those should do the trick.  Expect it to be PAR- when you target the docking port, getting that wrong can flip your rocket at a bad time.

Autopilots will definitely help. I'm not sure if you want this just to be precise with docking or that you have actual need for having it docking in a specified orientation?

If it's the latter you could also use 2 symmetrical docking ports in reflection to one another.
So you have 2 docking ports on the module your trying to dock with, and 2 on the orbiter your docking with.

This will make sure it docks at a preset orientation. You only have to make sure they do so properly by building it neatly enough in the VAB/SPH.
But a little bit of testing will get you there.
Modding question moved to the modding subforum.
The big issue with this is rotation stops when you leave physics range, so you need to get the resistant rotation mod.

Mechjeb does have the PAR+ and PAR- buttons, those should do the trick.  Expect it to be PAR- when you target the docking port, getting that wrong can flip your rocket at a bad time.

That wouldn't work, because the PAR only makes your craft parallel to the target, not aligned in terms of rotation.

MechJeb's docking autopilot can align the docking port with a moving ship (rotate to 0°) Then you could disengage it.
